response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age and Gender", "low", "22-year-old male, which is generally lower risk in these examples compared to those with multiple arrests or convictions."),
    ("Race", "low", "Identifies as White, which in these examples has not shown higher recidivism relative to other factors."),
    ("Arrest and Conviction History", "low", "Only 1 arrest and no convictions, a pattern commonly associated with lower recidivism in the provided cases."),
    ("Physical Characteristics", "low", "Average height and weight are not indicative of elevated risk."),
    ("Marital and Living Status", "low", "Never married but not living alone; not living alone can be a protective factor."),
    ("Education and Enrollment", "low", "Holds a high school diploma, and although not enrolled in college, this aligns with lower-risk examples."),
    ("Employment", "low", "Employment history includes holding 1 job, which is neutral to low risk in comparison to cases with unstable or no employment."),
    ("Substance Use", "low", "No drug use in the past four years, which is a protective factor against recidivism."),
    ("Depression History", "low", "No reported depression, aligning with lower risk."),
    ("Family Background", "low", "Household size of 4 at a young age is average and not associated with increased risk in these examples."),
    ("Religious Belief", "low", "Belief that God influences outcomes, a factor commonly observed in lower-risk examples.")
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 90
}

risk_factors: 22-year-old male, which is generally lower risk in these examples compared to those with multiple arrests or convictions.
Identifies as White, which in these examples has not shown higher recidivism relative to other factors.
Only 1 arrest and no convictions, a pattern commonly associated with lower recidivism in the provided cases.
Average height and weight are not indicative of elevated risk.
Never married but not living alone; not living alone can be a protective factor.
Holds a high school diploma, and although not enrolled in college, this aligns with lower-risk examples.
Employment history includes holding 1 job, which is neutral to low risk in comparison to cases with unstable or no employment.
No drug use in the past four years, which is a protective factor against recidivism.
No reported depression, aligning with lower risk.
Household size of 4 at a young age is average and not associated with increased risk in these examples.
Belief that God influences outcomes, a factor commonly observed in lower-risk examples.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. First,analyze the following example cases of risk factors and resulting 3 year rearrest recidivism outcome:

Example #1:
Risk Factors: The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 5 inches and weighs over 250 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 7, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.
Outcome: NO

Example #2:
Risk Factors: The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 7 inches and weighs 140 lbs. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.
Outcome: NO
